April 22, 1958
Following is Mr. Merrill April 17 letter to Dr. Skornia:
Dear Harry:
This letter is my official vote as a member of the Research Committee that the NAEB formally re¬
quests the Bureau of the Census to include questions about radio and television ownership in the
forthcoming 1960 Census of Housing. I believe that the Bureau should be requested specifically
to:
1 • Identify radio and television households on a county-by-
county basis •
2 • Identify each radio household as to whether it can receive FM •
3 • Identify each television household as to whether the set can
receive UHF and/or color.
You probably are already underway in this regard. A letter Armand received from Hal Fellows
stresses the urgency of action .lam proposing that we make common cause with the NAB in this
regard because it is my personal feeling that we would not get very far by requesting such services
only in those areas covered by educational broadcasting stations. Picking out such areas and
arranging the survey to include only them would be too much trouble for the Bureau of the Census.
Sincerely,,
/s/ prying R. Merrill
